item.title: SoftBank Posts Narrower Loss on Tech Funds Recovery
item.description: The Japanese investment company said its net asset value nearly doubled thanks to the rising share price of its U.K. chip-design unit, Arm.

item.title: Oil Edges Higher Ahead of Key U.S. Inflation Readings This Week
item.description: Oil prices edged higher as traders assessed China’s inflation data and ahead of key U.S. readings this week.

item.title: Gold Futures Fall Ahead of U.S. Inflation Data
item.description: Gold futures fell, giving way to a stronger dollar ahead of key inflation data this week.

item.title: Duke Students Walk Out Ahead of Jerry Seinfeld Commencement Speech
item.description: Dozens of students staged a walkout at Duke University’s graduation ceremony just before comedian Jerry Seinfeld’s commencement speech.

item.title: Australian Judge Ends Injunction Against X Over Stabbing Video
item.description: An Australian judge effectively lifted an order for social-media platform X to hide a video of the stabbing of a religious leader, which had drawn criticism from Elon Musk as an example of government overreach.

item.title: Sanofi to Spend $1 Billion to Boost Drug Production in France
item.description: Sanofi said the bulk of the investment will double capacity of monoclonal antibody production, which are key in developing an array of pharmaceuticals, at its Vitry-sur-Seine site.

item.title: Platinum Market Deficit Forecast Widens on Weak Supply, Sustained Demand
item.description: The precious metal is now forecast for a market deficit of 476,000 ounces in 2024 amid strained supply from the mining sector and resilient demand, according to a new report from the World Platinum Investment Council.

item.title: Nikkei Edges Down 0.1%, Weighed by Construction Stocks
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average edged down 0.1% to close at 38179.46, weighed by losses among construction stocks.

item.title: Country Garden Avoids Further Default With Payments on Onshore Bonds
item.description: Chinese property developer Country Garden made payments on two onshore bonds within a grace period, avoiding default days after the company had said it might turn to a state guarantor for help.

item.title: WuXi Shares Volatile as U.S. Bill Revised to Set Deadline for Decoupling
item.description: WuXi AppTec and its affiliates faced volatile trading after the introduction of a revised version of the Biosecure Act by U.S. lawmakers that gives U.S. companies time until 2032, after which business tie-ups with the named Chinese biotech firms would be restricted.

item.title: How China's 'Firewater' Became the World's Most Valuable Liquor Brand
item.description: Moutai is the world’s largest beverage company by market cap, yet it remains largely obscure among global consumers. WSJ looks at the liquor giant’s business strategies and the challenges ahead.

item.title: Russia's Bombardment of Ukraine Is More Lethal Than Ever
item.description: Ukraine is shooting down a far smaller proportion of Russian missile attacks than it was earlier in the war as its enemy launches more harder-to-hit weapons.

item.title: China to Start Sale of Ultralong Bond to Support Economy
item.description: China will start selling the first batch of a planned $138.37 billion ultralong bond issuance this week, as Beijing looks to provide more support to the economy.

item.title: Temu Cools on the U.S. After Shelling Out Billions
item.description: The Chinese-owned bargain app is looking to reduce its reliance on American shoppers as growth slows and scrutiny of TikTok grows.

item.title: Suddenly There Aren't Enough Babies. The Whole World Is Alarmed.
item.description: B​irthrates are falling fast across countries, ​with economic, social and geopolitical ​consequences. “The demographic winter is coming.”

item.title: Richard Slayman, the man who received a genetically modified pig kidney in an unprecedented transplant at a Boston hospital, has died.
item.description: Richard Slayman, the man who received a genetically modified pig kidney in an unprecedented transplant at a Boston hospital, has died.

item.title: Putin nominated an economist to succeed Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu, a longtime ally, in the most substantial shake-up to Russia's military command structure since Moscow launched its war on Ukraine.
item.description: Putin nominated an economist to succeed Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu, a longtime ally, in the most substantial shake-up to Russia’s military command structure since Moscow launched its war on Ukraine.

item.title: More seaborne migrants are reaching the U.S., with illegal entries or attempted entries by boat in California more than doubling over a three-year period, according to Customs and Border Protection.
item.description: More seaborne migrants are reaching the U.S., with illegal entries or attempted entries by boat in California more than doubling over a three-year period, according to Customs and Border Protection.

item.title: Nearly 60% of Argentines are living in poverty, up from 44% when Javier Milei was inaugurated as president in December, according to the Catholic University.
item.description: Nearly 60% of Argentines are living in poverty, up from 44% when Javier Milei was inaugurated as president in December, according to the Catholic University.

item.title: Consumer-facing brands with spots to place have so far been disappointed in their hope that the rise of ad-supported streaming would compensate for the decline of traditional television.
item.description: Consumer-facing brands with spots to place have so far been disappointed in their hope that the rise of ad-supported streaming would compensate for the decline of traditional television.
